title: Stomp Lox and LaRon SLAK SPD Shoes in Stock Now
content:
They’ve finally landed at Rons Bikes. The Stomp Lox Rons edition is made in Japan exclusively for LaRon. The Connecticut cycling brand is dynamically delighted to re-introduce the wide-toe boxed Stomp Lox SLAK SPD cycling shoe collaboration ($315).

Ronnie came across these shoes 4 years ago and just had to have them.  The problem was they were not yet offered in Euro or American sizes, so Ron offered my foot to science, and over the span of the next several years, Mamiya at Stomp Lox and he worked together to get these shoes made at a high-end shoe shop in Japan of the highest quality materials the two could source. They are lace-up with full-grain leather and are compatible with all 2-bolt cleat systems.

If these are too spendy for your wallet, there is a suede Chinese made version for $65 less that you can get from Stomp Lox in Japan.  

Check ’em out at Rons Bikes.
